text.p: Oncogene Science Inc said Thursday that it has further extended its collaborative agreement with partner Hoechst Marion Roussel AG for an additional 15 months until March 31, 2002.

Prior to the acquisition of Marion Merrell Dow Inc by Hoechst AG in July 1995, Oncogene had collaborative agreements with the two companies, in addition to an agreement with Hoechst AG's U.S. based entity Hoechst Roussel Pharmaceuticals Inc.

In June 1996, Oncogene and Hoechst Marion Roussel jointly announced an agreement-in-principle to consolidate the existing agreements into one collaborative program, and extended the program through December 31, 2000.
Oncogene said that the extended program will continue to focus on the discovery and development of orally active, small molecule drugs to treat cardiovascular and inflammatory diseases.
Hoechst Marion Roussel will continue to provide research funding and will pay royalties to Oncogene on the sale of any drugs derived from the program, it said.
